Description: Hammered and turned brass bowl with straight sides and a flat base. Centering marks on the inside and concentric circles engraved on the base. Inlayed with silver and black and decorated with three panels of inscriptions alternate with panels of carpet foliate pattern. Panels separated by roundels containing, alternately, a pen box blazon in the centre of a three-field shield or a Y-pattern. Fringe of palmettes below panels and cable design around rim. Inscription inlaid with silver on a blackened ground.
Curator's comments: The pen box blazon was used frequently on objects in the late Mamluk period and not necessarily linked to court secretaries.
Bibliographic references: Reinaud 1828 / Monumens arabes, persans et turcs du cabinet de M. le Duc de Blacas et d'autres cabinets, considérés et décrits d'après leurs rapports avec les croyances les moeurs et l'histoire des nations musulmanes (vol. II., p.443-446)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Pierre, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
